wC-WGRH_WYVe_SHJCF4nFw.text: A very friendly place, with tasty, huge portions! I had the 3-course pre-theatre menu and it was enough for 2 people easily for 13.95, which is crazy cheap for smoked salmon, a huge pizza, plus flan for dessert. Subtle flavors for those of us used to more robust Italian, but you can ask for more seasoning. I'd come again when I'm next in the area. Great value and location.

BF58YOiAFRdh6Ppp-RU5AQ.text: No better in London.  Super friendly staff, great specials, fantastic wine, and pasta like you were in Rome.  Outside seating area the best.  Off the path somewhat, but well worth it.

EsSgNA6JZ36kigjixNy5sQ.text: My grandmother had just got into London, and we decided to go to this place and I'm glad we did! The food was very good and filling. Neither of us finished, which hasn't happen to me yet in London, and this is my third week being here. We both got the regular size, so if you're trying to decide, I'd probably go for the small, unless you're very hungry. I had a mango juice cocktail, which was just like mango juice, and that seemed a bit expensive for the size it was, but other than that the food seems reasonably priced. Our waitress was very nice, and the rest of the staff was very friendly too. It was a nice place to start of my grandmother's London experience!

jYFQoplDlR6H8iqNrZyawA.text: I LOVED the service here, the waiters that served us were so caring and attentive, it was fairly empty around lunchtime so we did receive quite a lot of service. The atmosphere was great I wouldn't be surprised if we'd spent over two hours in the restaurant, our waiter even let us sample the wines for free, and have us some free starters (though I don't think that is regulation treatment of customers so don't expect this when you go).The service alone makes this place a 9/10, but with the food we received 5/10, considering it being an Italian restaurant the least we'd expect was an immaculate meatballs and pasta ?

photos.caption: Photo of Spaghetti House - London, United Kingdom

fpjPr4ix8FUyv8iCrZofGg.text: After walking around Hyde park and spending some time being entertained for free at Speakers' Corner, my boyfriend and I were starving. Using my trusty Yelp app, we found Spaghetti house and I am sure glad we did. The service was superior to what we have experienced in the London before. We were greeted with huge friendly smiles and very quick service. Our food took a little time to come out, but it was well worth the wait. I got the "spaghetti aglio, olio e peperoncino" and it was perfectly al dente and would order it over and over again. I cannot remember what my boyfriend got, but it definitely had seafood in it (which is why I choose to forget it) and he definitely said it was good. I can definitely recommend this Spaghetti house for both the service and the food and would come back if I am ever lucky enough to be in London again.

pJ6k6fnl3b8YKBb72uAcTg.text: If this restaurant was a chain, it certainly didn't seem like it.  We enjoyed eating here--clean and moderately priced.  Apparently, they cater a lot of private parties downstairs, but we ate early and were seated straight away.  Our waiters (several served us) were attentive--for London--but not as present as we had hoped for.  Our drinks went empty for more than a few minutes, and we had to ask every time we needed something.The food was good.  I had the pot of clams with linguine, and it was fine.  My friend has spaghetti and thought it was just average in quality and taste.  The soda drinks were typical for London--no free refills, and we had to ask for ice.I liked Spaghetti House.  We liked the area and thought the restaurant was nicely situated just off busy Oxford Street.  There's a Patisserie Valerie across the street, so skip the pricey desserts and cafe by heading to P.V. instead.

photos.caption: Photo of Spaghetti House - London, United Kingdom. Clams & linguini
Photo of Spaghetti House - London, United Kingdom. January 2011

iGJOHVURtcRuobt6q8DNYg.text: This is a chain restaurant.  The food and service were excellent. I enjoyed the trout and salad very much. The spaghetti bolognese was perfect.

2RqHLzUURAFkbTg6pPF5yg.text: the food was awesome! they also were super friendly and helpful. everyone in my group was extremely pleased with their meal!

1R132tEQRhJjYD2CT_8J3g.text: The food is good, but I had the feeling that I was in a hurry in that place, I felt like I needed to order fast - eat fast - pay and leave, it didn't feel welcoming for me at all. The food was good and also was the bread buuut they didn't tasted like fresh bread to me.

photos.caption: Photo of Spaghetti House - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Spaghetti House - London, United Kingdom. Bread box to go!
Photo of Spaghetti House - London, United Kingdom

zWCPAtifKxjVPH4Ci8uOag.text: We had a large group which they easily accommodated.  Each meal was incredible, from the pizza to the chicken.  The olives were the freshest I've ever had!

tSQoMOEAygbyxQlhbQzC6w.text: Came here a few times during my stay in London's Marble Arch area and every time I've been pleased with the service, food, prices and the ambience. My server, Ilaria, is professional and pleasant. She takes care of me every time I come here to dine. And for a chain restaurant I was even more impressed with the quality of food. Its really good. Come and check them out.

EirWfOcEOdlUNSBRXvM-Rg.text: On a business trip I happened into this particular Spaghetti House just down the street from where I was staying. I was traveling alone this time and was really hankering for some decent Italian.Now the Spaghetti House is a regional UK chain with many spaces throughout the city. I have eaten at many of them before on previous trips, but really never considered them much more than pedestrian from the experience. Therefore, I walked into this particular Spaghetti House with nothing more than average expectations.I was dining late and it was the holiday shopping season, mid-week. The Oxford and Bond Street retailers were wide open with the locals on the streets weighed down with their bags and boxes. The restaurant was full with only a couple seats available.I walked in and was told it would be a 5 minute wait. That was not problem, it was a crisp and cool evening. No problem waiting outside. About 2 minutes later I was alerted I could be seated. I was placed in the front main room at a table for two facing the street.The menu was typical and the same as the others I had dined at before. They did had a polpette with pasta special in a spicy red sauce on the board. That I knew I would have. I also ordered a tomato, caper and anchovy salad.The salad course came out quick, just in time for me to enjoy with my first of more than a few Peronis. Crisp, cool and light, the salad was a great starter. It even came with a decent piece of fresh bread.After another Peroni, the secundi pasta course came out. It was about 10 oz of pasta, a very generous portion. The sauce was bright red and extremely flavorful. I know they used canned tomatoes, but that's OK since the best and consistent sauces are based on a canned product, especially when the canned tomatoes are imported from Italy.  What a chef adds to the tomatoes is what's key. This one was treated with roasted garlic, capers, finely diced onions, harissa paste (very uniquie and moderately spicy) and really good quality minced anchovy. Black pepper and a lite treatment of salt and that's all she wrote. The meatballs were pork and veal, exactly the way they should be. Oven roasted and tossed with the sauce. The flake your own parmigiana origianna from a block was a nice touch.The space is very tastefully decorated, not red and white checkered table cloths but nice bright and earthy tones.OK, for London Italian fare this Spaghetti House is better than most Italian Eating Houses I have experienced, and definitely the better of the chain.Only problem - the menu is still moderately expensive, even by London  standards.  My meal, less the Peronis, was $38 USD including service charge. The same meal in Los Angeles would run less than $20 including taxes and tip.

Wfjll3LllLEevpmrgUlrig.text: Would have given it 4 starts BUT the waiter copped an attitude when we inquired as to out mains after 40 minutes waiting.  Yes we had a starter that was out in about 10.. So 30 minutes after seemed long.  It's not the wait it's the ATTITUDE.  -2 stars

L7oVBUMlBILBAxBER2bshg.text: It is a Restaurant Chain.  The food is fine, maybe not the best Italian food, but quite acceptable.  Not very cheap.  Our waiter was very friendly.

g7oLKJtN6ZOWl3Bdm0s2Ag.text: The food is great, prices are reasonable, the service at this location is absolutely terrible. Worth going if you have the patience for the staff.

LQhdXDcSfmV_AGBUTHAV2g.text: We had dinner here twice because it was so close to our hotel. However there were many local people here as well. The food was authentic Italian and the wait staff were Italian. The fish was tasty, salads were good and the pasta to share was delicious and plenty for two.

0-XV_fkiUHfqp3S1wHfHIg.text: The food here was okay and the service wasn't bad either.  I would say on all accounts the restaurant was moderate but good enough for a quick bite to eat.  We didn't feel rushed as some others mentioned.

kcGay29IZ-rDhh7NrsOtKw.text: this is a lovely little restaurant...great welcome. the menu has a wide range of items and the waiters/waitresses are very helpful in explaining the menu. The food taste great...once I ordered a salad but it had pasta in it and I didnt know. I requested on without pasta and they didnt charge me for the meal. It's just a nice restaurant to have a good meal at a fairly reasonable price.

0C6AA9cpuZk4hFHD7198cA.text: The place is really good. They have impeccable service and obviously a good chef, as I was pleasantly surprised by my the taste of my meal.

McOUKS6sgZXnWFwPnZ3cjw.text: Fantastic garlic tomato pizza starter. Pasta dishes are quite good as well. Service is quite good. One of our favourites in the location.

JYV17U0Zc1gqsuT0c8wkvg.text: EXCELLENT!!!  Visiting from L.A. And didn't want to eat at the hotel again. So I looked for a place close by. I found Spaghetti House. I set my expectations low so I wouldn't be disappointed (I have VERY high standards for fine dining, particularly Italian). I figured it should be OK, but wasn't expecting to be wowed. WOW!! Despite the casual atmosphere the food was excellent. My wife and I decided we wanted a bit of pasta and chicken. So we ordered Spaghetti Bolognese and Pollo Alla Siciliana. Both dishes were delicious. The Bolognese sauce is probably the best I've had. I highly recommend this place if you like REALLY good Italian food.

0wkdzZZW9IkUfgSyqYArWQ.text: Visiting from California, we were driven here by the 5 star reviews. Came hungry and with great expectations. This is a pretty, inviting and cozy little place. We were greeted, however, with a dry, not so friendly salutation. We ordered aperol spritz to drink. They are handsome sparkling drinks. We got spaghetti bolognese and the maccheroni pesto rosso siciliano. The spaghetti was delicious and on point. The maccheroni pasta, however, was not tender so didn't enjoy. I was expecting a basket of bread to go with the dinner and when it never showed up, I asked for it only to find out that you have to order it. So I ordered it, but they were out! Really?? Well there goes the review. The portions were small and we left hungry and dissatisfied. Very disappointed. I went next door for a slice of pizza!

photos.caption: Photo of Spaghetti House - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Spaghetti House - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Spaghetti House - London, United Kingdom. maccheroni pesto rosso siciliano

tv3Go9OLuIl2hSDnJ9wsxg.text: We had dinner here tonight and loved it!  We probably arrived at 5-5:30pm, and we were seated immediately.  The restaurant was easy to find by foot (we walked from the Hyatt on Churchill), clean and family-friendly.For our 6 year old we ordered a fried dough appetizer that  came with a tomato sauce (which was really good but I forgot the name of the dish) and a very good sized-dish of Spaghetti Bolognese - all for $6.  His dishes were all very good. My husband ordered garlic bread and we got two salads on the side. Our waiter recommend we get two different types of salad, and I'm glad he did because both were good - not fancy, but very fresh.  I had their lasagna, which I loved.  It's individually baked and tasted great.  My husband had some seafood pasta which came with a generous portion of shellfish and pasta.  I also asked for Prosecco, but the waiter recommended an Italian drink that is made with Prosecco, which I liked.Overall we had really delicious food.  The waiter listened to what we wanted, but made suggestions for new things that were similar to what we asked for - with no pressure to order what he suggested.  I loved it and when I visit London, I won't mind eating here again!

photos.caption: Photo of Spaghetti House - London, United Kingdom. The kid's Soaghetti Bolognese with a ton of grated parmesean cheese on top
Photo of Spaghetti House - London, United Kingdom. A seafood pasta - also a generous portion
Photo of Spaghetti House - London, United Kingdom. The kid's Spaghetti Bolognese

hXsU4zIjIXKO1j4S7AfxKA.text: Not worth the visit. The pasta sauce was dull and boring, the meatballs were overcooked and like stones. Pushy wait-staff that kept trying to upcharge us for items. I was very dissatisfied and should have just got a sandwich at a place around the block.

G1I1d0UgnUsXLScNYI5riQ.text: Mixed feelings! The bruschetta bread was not very impressive and neither were the tomatoes - may just be out of season. The pasta - which I was told is fresh- is not. Or at least it wasn't your typical softer / chewier feeling you get with fresh pasta. The saving grace though, was the soup. Holy crap if this isn't the best soup I've ever had.

A7dzKFCXWji8ZYaO7YeUhg.text: I ordered the bolognese with tagliatelle for lunch. Fast, friendly and polite service. The food was pretty standard - though they don't bring out complimentary bread and oil to start which I thought was a given for a proper Italian!Being a chain, it's not going to blow you away. But for a standard Italian quick lunch, it's pretty good.

photos.caption: Photo of Spaghetti House - London, United Kingdom. Tagliatelle bolognese 10.50

JhQ2vZFF9T8MzWMpeD0uMg.text: What a delightful little place! I picked this restaurant on our first night in London because it was very close to the hotel & the reviews. We were warmly greeted & seated in the back dining room. Cute place & great atmosphere.Our server was phenomenal! He's original from Portugal but when he found H was from Argentina he started speaking in Spanish. He asked me if I spoke Spanish & I mentioned that I was 1/2 Japanese. Guess what? Yep, he started talking to me in Japanese & knew the language better than I (which isn't that hard but the words I recognized were legit). I ordered the penne di mare & H opted for the special which was lobster with spaghetti cherry tomatoes, garlic & red pepper. OMG, the food was freakin delicious! There was a ton of mussels, clams, calamari, shrimp & diced pancetta with tomatoes, garlic & red peppers. Loved the spiciness of the dish & loved that it wasn't drowned in a sauce. Just simple olive oil based goodness.We had a wonderful time at this place & I was surprised to find that this is a chain (my niece's boyfriend had a less than nice experience at another location). This is the location to go to if you want delicious food with excellent service.

1yBi45IEpFyXPc1cAEvzaA.text: Nice little place with affordable food. I particularly liked that they had a "noodle free" option that included spiralized carrots and zucchini rather than pasta. I don't eat carbs so this was an exciting find!! Wait staff very accommodating.

photos.caption: Photo of Spaghetti House - London, United Kingdom

n57E9mhwWrTdQACzv9wL6w.text: I made reservations over the phone for lunch with a friend a day before our lunch date and the person who took my call was very friendly!On getting there, the staff were very nice,friendly and welcoming. We ordered, my friend had the taglietelle pollo and I had the panciotti. They were both really tasty!! What I really loved was the portion sizes they have for the pastas. There's a normal portion and a smaller one which they called 'starter portion'  The only problem I had was that they do not give the complementary bread before the meal. They asked what we wanted bread/olives? We chose olives and paid for it!!I will definitely go back though! Good service!

photos.caption: Photo of Spaghetti House - London, United Kingdom. Panciotti. A starter portion,perfect for me!

IeeEmsqWYgi1CJcsd6FqFA.text: My mom and I just got to London for the first time and I saw this place on Yelp. So glad we did! It's a cute, small, Italian spot. We both loved our meals - the maccheroni pesto rosso siciliano & the Spaghetti Pomodoro E Basilico. We will definitely be back sometime during our 10-day stay to try the bruschetta and assorted bread basket. The people around us had it and it looked delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Spaghetti House - London, United Kingdom. maccheroni pesto rosso siciliano
Photo of Spaghetti House - London, United Kingdom. Spaghetti Pomodoro E Basilico

SeCfXDNVJNjH7r7nxEIogw.text: I had the bolognese and the tiramisu. You should get those too. They were great. Maybe the best I've had. Seriously, this place is amazing.

rsJ6KDgoGwlT7UkyMzM9xQ.text: Great food. Not too busyNice choice of deserts.The booths have plenty of leg room ;-)

photos.caption: Photo of Spaghetti House - London, United Kingdom

MkJ6aVJA9_R8u1EcFJrdZQ.text: Saw this on yelp and thought I'd give it a shot.  Very busy at lunch but managed to score a table for 3. I'm ordered the lasagna and it was delicious.  One ordered the pizza margarita and the other ordered a sea food pasta - all had rave reviews.Service was very good as well.  I'd definitely stop again.

E3d3C0HlJxoCk7lFhpU44g.text: Pasta was not fresh - did not have a softer/chewier feeling you get with fresh pasta. We ordered olives and bread which were fine. The saving grace was the desert (brownie) which was delicious. The staff are friendly and efficient.

pfRerTh9GP_2WrKqIr2QTg.text: Great people, great food, great fun. Not pretentious, but we had a great meal and a good bottle of wine to boot. Casual atmosphere.

uDaYTtwKHLHrok-xET-lcw.text: Friendly staff, but food was average.  Kids ordered spaghetti bolognese and pizza with ham and mushrooms.  I ordered spaghetti carbonara and husband ordered scapolla di vitelo.

pNAmTVCiO3YeJ9JdxGc5ew.text: Honestly one of the best places to eat Italian food!! I guess I don't have a great experience eating authentic Italian cuisine because in America most of the food I eat is Italian American, but still i thought it tasted amazing. All the ingredients were rich in flavour and the portions were not big at all, which is usually a problem in America. A nice filling meal and a great place to go with friends. All of us had an amazing time :-)

JAOlDQPMY-0ehZtIX5K-kA.text: I had the spaghetti and meatballs and my husband had the crab linguine. Both were excellent and the atmosphere is friendly and relaxed. It was my favorite meal in London.

jzWoI6jDUOKtsNiA0n254g.text: I didn't really like anything on their menu so I made my own pasta. I asked for linguini (they didn't have fettuccine) with Alfredo sauce. They added mushrooms and broccoli. It was absolutely perfect. The pasta tasted better than the pasta in Italy (I've been to Italy).The appetizers are super mediocre so I suggest skipping those. The service is really great.

I0LT7mA_Wj3ytmFzo6hrsw.text: Currently eating here. Everything is amazing. I highly recommend visiting this pasta palace.
